newsitem.title: TOGO: Five West African states plan common visa policy.
newsitem.headline: Five West African states plan common visa policy.

text.p: Tourism and security ministers from five West African states forming the Entente Council have adopted a convention for a common visa policy in the region.
The ministers from Benin, Burkina Faso, Ivory Coast, Niger and Togo said after a meeting in Lome on Friday that the objective was to boost their earnings from tourism.
Under the measure, expected to be approved later in the year by Entente heads of state, a tourist visa for any one member country would do for travel in the the rest.
A final communique said the ministers also agreed on the need to "guarantee the security of tourists" in line with a security cooperation convention they signed in Togo in 1996.
The Abidjan-based Entente promotes economic development, with activities ranging from the building of hotels to the running of vocational training centres and joint agricultural projects.
All the five French-speaking nations also belong to the 16-member Economic Community of West African States whose citizens do not require visas for travel in the region.
